name: Vegetarian Nori Miso
author: Retroantix
summary: I began trying to make a clear soup recipe, which quickly grew out of control to incorporate elements of miso, egg drop soup, and seaweed. I serve it as a main dish with a side of brown basmati rice.
directions: Combine vegetable broth and water in a large pot; bring to a boil
Drop egg whites into the boiling broth and boil until egg whites are cooked, about 10 seconds
Skim egg whites from surface of broth using a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate to cool
Mix miso paste, ginger paste, and sesame oil into broth using a potato masher or ladle until fully incorporated

Add edamame, mushrooms, spring onion, garlic, and soy sauce to miso broth; cover pot with a lid, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until mushrooms are no longer floating on the surface, about 10 minutes
Mix tofu and cayenne pepper into miso broth
Tear cooled egg whites into small pieces and add to miso broth
Stir nori and sugar into miso broth; cover pot and simmer, stirring occasionally, until soup flavors have blended, about 1 hour
